intro: Codonanthopsis macradenia, commonly known as the large-leafed moss rose, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
